SEARCH
Module FloWeekTracker
Package com.floweektracker.view

Class TaskNamesDialog

java.lang.Object
com.floweektracker.view.TaskNamesDialog
public class TaskNamesDialog extends Object
Represents the UI of the task names database allowing users to add and remove task names in a database. It shows a list of task names. It also provides possibility to add or remove the task name. This class is a singleton.

Fields: view, dialog, taskNamesScrollPane, taskNameInputField, buttons, taskNamesList, visible

Dialog creating methods: initTaskNamesDialog()

Left panel creating methods: createLeftPanel(), createTaskNamesScrollPane()

Right panel creating methods: createRightPanel(), createTaskAddingPanel(), createTaskNameInputField(), createButtonsPanel(), createButton(String, String)

Helper methods: createPanel(String, LayoutManager), createLabel(String, String)

Getter methods: getTaskNameFromInputField(), getSelectedTaskNameFromTaskNamesList()

Setter methods: setTaskNameInInputField(String), setTaskNamesList(String[])

Other methods:makeDialogVisible()

  • Method Details

    • makeDialogVisible

      public void makeDialogVisible()
      Makes dialog visible. It runs the dialog in a separate thread. Before it sets visibility as true, it sleeps for 1s.
      See Also:
      • invalid reference 
        #isVisible()
      • MainPanelController.addListenerToButtons()

    • getTaskNameFromInputField

      public String getTaskNameFromInputField()
      Returns:
      a String with the task name from the taskNameInputField when it is not blank, otherwise null
